Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service & Stay...”
Reviews.Author: MissBB80
Reviews.Content: I have only good things to say about the hotel and our stay. Their welcome was very appreciated and EXTREMELY helpful! It was great to be greeted upon arrival and to be able to ask as many questions regarding things to do and see in istanbul. the room itself was immaculate..clean and with all modern decor. The hotel was very well situated (at Taksim Square) and it had very easy access to the old town area via metro and tram only a few minutes walk away. I would definitely stay there again and would also recommend it to anyone else thinking of travelling to istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, stylish hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: GermanyStephan
Reviews.Content: In a big city like Istanbul it is very difficult to find a quiet hotel in the very centre of town, but this is what Gezi has to offer. PERFECT LOCATION. Staff is very friendly and the hotel is basically brand new, so you will find great mattresses and bathrooms, huge shower etc. The view to the Bosphorus side is stunning! You have to try the SPA (included in the room price) very relaxful.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Victor77777
Reviews.Content: Very positive feedback on recent stay at the hotel: convinient location (close to Taxim, but not noisy), good service, very good rooms with Bosphorus view. Hotel was very kind to provide free room upgrade - a pleasant news at arrival.

Reviews.Title: “A great alternative boutique hotel in taksim area.”
Reviews.Author: RavingRover
Reviews.Content: The free upgrade on first night had awesome views, though had a stale smell of cigarettes. Luckily I was moved to my proper booked room on day 2 so much happier with being higher up with clean smell yet less of a view. Service was outstanding throughout. My only criticism was the there was no iron in the whole hotel! Unbelievable that they expect professionals to run up and not need to iron for a same day or day 1 appointment. On asking I was offered express laundry which did come back to me after one day. Seriously at over 200 euros a night how hard is it to have one shared iron??????? Restaurant was good and breakfast included gave lots of options. Will sty there again but would need to think bout the shirt ironing options in advance!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Jas K
Reviews.Content: This hotel was PERFECT. The area is amazing, a walk to everything, shopping, the square, transportation, restaurants. The view of the Bosphorus is breathtaking. The Spa is amazing. The service is superb, the breakfast is SO tasty with tons of variety. The service is first class. I LOVED this hotel and will definitely go back. I will recommend them to everyone!! Thanks for an awesome stay Gezi :) P.S. The room service food is the best I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST hotel in Taksim”
Reviews.Author: Evertough
Reviews.Content: I spent three wonderful nights at Gezi Hotel from 14th to 17th of March 2012. I must say that this hotel is perfectly placed with easy access to just about everywhere in the city. The room was well equipped and very very clean. The view of the Bosphorus from the room is fantastic. Dining services are great too; good variety of food, excellent service. Having your breakfast in their restaurant with stunning views of the Bosphorus is just relaxing, let alone the attentive restaurant staff who don't give you the chance to call them if you need anything as they unobtrusively take care of you. As for getting about, the metro is easy, cheap and very near, the famous Taksim Square and Istiklal street are two minutes away where masses of shops (branded), small bazzars, cafes and restaurants fill the area. Internet is super-fast and they gave us free wireless access throughout our stay. I don't know if this was part of my package or they do this to all guests. Unlike other hotels where you get a single password which you can only use to access Internet through only one device, in Gezi Hotel they were very generous and happily gave us three access points for my iPhone, my laptop and my wife's iPad! Staff offer exceptional service without being over the top and they all seem genuinely pleased to be working here. I would especially like to thank the front office team, who were very friendly and efficient; had a good check-in and out experience and they were very helpful throughout my stay. My special thanks go to Ms. Dilhan GÃ¶kmen who graced us with her smile every morning and helped us with her experience and advice in getting around Istanbul. I will definitely come again and again to Gezi Hotel Bosphorus and I strongly recommend it to anyone who wants quality and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dan T
Reviews.Content: A cautious and well detailed boutique hotel, where it is worthwhile paying a premium price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dimitra18
Reviews.Content: The view is excellnet! The rooms very clean and the staff friendly and always there to help you about whatever you need!Moreover the massage treatments were really good but maybe a little expensive. Overall I am very satisfied with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but a bit cold.”
Reviews.Author: Sally_282
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend. Nice Very Clean room! Very good breakfast. The location is a good starting point for those who don't want to visit just the old town. The personnel was kind but not cozy. No good sound isolation. We could hear the neighbor rooms clearly, which was annoying.

Reviews.Title: “3 cheers and many thanks to GEZI HOTEL :):):)”
Reviews.Author: sinduri
Reviews.Content: nice location, good hotel, better service & the best staff.. :):):) we had a very comfortable stay and a lovely time.. :):):)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frleb
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! the location is excellent near Taksim! Breakfast food is varied with a lot to eat!! The spa is a plus if you have time to do it! Newly renovated! The service is also gr8 the rooms are clean and very modern! The rain shower is amazing plus you can listen to music while in the shower from the TV. I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Professional & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Sradin
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel in a wonderful location. Concierge servce is flawless. Choose from the rooms with Bosphorus view, it worths.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mishrahat
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights. Excellent hotel, very friendly staff. Central location, modern, clean and stylish. No real faults at all. Some nice touches like the electronic safe and free bottled water. The rooms seem a bit smaller becasue of the darker colour schemes but actually are completey fine. Breakfast was excellent. Popular with many nationalities. The hotel was quiet even though kids were staying on our floor. Would recommend !

Reviews.Title: “Fab!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Harris F
Reviews.Content: An unforgettable & very friendly staying in an one of a kind Bosphorus view hotel! The excellent service with the extremely kind front office stuff made us feel, those couple of days like staying in a Turskish Paladium!!!! Warm, friendly, beautifully simple with the dash of daring in the Bosphorus outside view!!! Perfect at all!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, attentive personnel, new room, cozy furniture .. I would give it 11/ 10 :)”
Reviews.Author: RaffyKaramanian
Reviews.Content: - centrally located next to taksim, train station, restaurants, etc.. - rooms are small but yet the right size with new furniture and perfect seating if u have a friend or two to join. - staff is extremely friendly and nice and try to get out of their way to help you out. - the view is beatuful and overlooking the bosphrus. - excellent Internet access. - the lobby is small, but heard it will be made bigger within the coming month which should solve the issue. - a perfect place for a couple, and tourists that are coming in.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel to a beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: Marianna A
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just a dream.!!The front office staff was so kind and the service was excellent because we asked for a romantic room and they gave as a wonderfull room with a view of Bosphorus. Breakfast was fine specially for those like us who wanted to sleep more in the morning since was served until 10.30.! The room and all the hotel was very clean and whenever we asked something we had it the next minute. We also thought helpfull the location of the hotel which was close to bus stop and metro.So for transportation there was no need to take our car. I highly recommend to everyone Gezi Hotel for a very pleasant experience.!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located hotel with polite and attentive personnel”
Reviews.Author: Bleufeather
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel a few days ago and we had a very good experience overall! The personnel are very polite and helpful. A couple of months ago when I was searching for a hotel to stay in Istanbul I came in contact with the hotel to ask some questions about internet access etc and they were very helpful, answering me straight away. We also received a free upgrade for a Bosphorus view room which was one of the most positive parts of our stay! The restaurant is indeed very good, although Istanbul has many good places for food I would recommend for someone to have dinner in the restaurant once during their stay. Breakfast was fine, it lasts until 10.30 strictly (after that in about 5-10 minutes everything is gone!). The only negative experience we had, was that our room had a bad smell sometimes coming from the bathroom. I had not contacted the management about this as by the time we came back at the room the first time we were very tired to short this out and then the next time that happened was during our last night and we left the next day. I am not sure if they could do much though as the smell was coming from the sewage. The ventilation was not working. The room was contemporary decorated and the bathroom had a lovely marble finishing. And just a tip for the management which may be looked at, the pillows were either very big (I believe these were the decorative pillows) or very small (the actual sleeping pillows), none was very convenient. The hotel is located close to the metro station and close to restaurants & shops. Internet access is fast in the lobby & restaurant. There is free internet access in the rooms but as we were on the 7th floor the signal was not strong. As previously said all hotel personnel was very polite and helpful. We had some drinks and the waiter was very polite and the front office staff were arranging our excursion or giving us tips whenever we needed them!

Reviews.Title: “Silver Spa @ Gezi Bosphorus Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thatgirldani
Reviews.Content: I experienced a number of wonderful treatments at the Silver Spa including the Hamam and facials. The design of this small spa is nice and the international staff are attentive and well trained. You are in good hands here. Enjoy the sauna, steambath, sit back and relax :)

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: kazyol
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Gezi Hotel Bosphorus this past weekend for some relaxation and shopping. Hotel is located in the Taksim region, closest to the best shopping with a host of great restaurants. The hotel is strategically located next to the metro and bus stops enabling easy transportation to all the renowned sites in Istanbul, if you are looking at getting around for less. We utilized a taxi service organized by the concierge, which arrived in less than two minutes. We utilized the hotel's Bistro on the first floor for dinner our first night, excellent food and service as the weather was less than desirable and after several flight delays, chose to stay in our first night. We had two entrees and two salads with a bottle of Chilean wine for fifty bucks each with tip. The waiters were at our side constantly refreshing our wine glasses, providing fresh bread and clearing the last course. We could not have asked for more. Rooms are beautifully decorated with the finest decor - and the hotel is new. We had a garden room with a patio, unfortunately it was too cold to take advantage of the outdoor seating set aside for our room. Property is non-smoking as seems to be the case in most hotels and all restaurants now in Istanbul. I am sure there is not a problem during the summer when outdoor seating is available. The hotel has 11+ floors, ours was named the 1st floor but in all actuality, was located four floors below the lobby. The only setback was that the room was a bit cold as the temperatures over the weekend were below 10 degrees Celsius with wicked wind gusts. Therefore, there was a draft and floors were cold in the room and bathroom/shower as they are marble. We requested a second key to keep the heating running during our absence from the room which kept the temperature comfortable. I would suggest having a room on a higher floor. The rate we paid was exceptionally low for this class of hotel, so no complaints there. Our room came with breakfast which was excellent with a full array of cold cuts, cheeses, eggs, salads, Turkish pastries, coffee, tea and cereals, anything for any taste. Service was terrific. All in all, an excellent establishment and we would highly recommend. KUDOS to Kemel at the door, he was extremely helpful as was the receptionist considerate. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth checking”
Reviews.Author: Michel J
Reviews.Content: I have been coming often to Istanbul for work abd staying in Gezi Bosphorus. It is a nice boutique hotel with comfortable and modern rooms. Views on Bosphorus are great but even views on the Gezi park are quite pleasant. Ideally located, very close to Taksim square, Metro station, Nisantasi. Reasonably priced. The breakfast is not fantastic but acceptable, above average food and clean. Haven't had the chance to use the gym but will hopefully do next time. The lobby is definitely on the smaller side, but it is nice and sleek, and they have business facilities on a separate floor. All in all, great hotel worth checking for both leisure and business travelers

Reviews.Title: “Gezi Hotel Bosphorous”
Reviews.Author: Mohamad C
Reviews.Content: very nicely located hotel 2 minutes walk from Taksim Sq and Istiklal Street. Easy access to metro. high-tech comfortable modern rooms. nice view on the Bosphorous. friendly and helpful staff. restaurant serves above average food. breakfast is acceptable. highly recommended for short stay or business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: lu412
Reviews.Content: Outstanding boutique hotel, the best combination of perfect location, style, design and comfort!!! Each guest is treated individually having access to the recommendations of the best places of Istanbul. Rooms are bright, clean, equipped with everything needed! Restaurant-bar was delicious, breakfasts very tasty, giving a perfect start of the day! What to say I would choose this hotel again and again coming back to Istanbul and would definitely recomend it to my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Increadable Experience”
Reviews.Author: raul151
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at Gezi Hotel. Simply perfect. The rooms are very nice and excellent restaurant in the heart of Istanbul. Amazing experience and best service. I recommend everyone who wants to have luxury and be at the heart of Istanbul at the same time. BRAVO!

Reviews.Title: “The staff made a difference”
Reviews.Author: RWpng
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gezi for 6 days over the New Year holidays . From the moment we arrived to the time we departed ,6 days later , it was the hotel staff who made staying at the Gezi a wonderful experience. The staff at the reception, restaurant , housekeeping were friendly and helpful. The Director of Guest Relations was highly customer focused. She was approachable, caring and knowledgeable. She made good suggestions and arrangements on restaurants to have a dining experience and sightseeing sites that gave an appreciation of the atraction of Istanbul. The location of the hotel was excellent . It was within walking distance to many interesting sites including Taksim Square, Dolmabahce Palace and Galata Towers and Gezi Hotel lived up to its name as Gezi Hotel Bosphorus with an amazing view of the Bosphorus. The room had a fantastic view and clean but we found it rather small ,for the price paid and certain aspects of the modern design impractical The restaurant offered a generous breakfast selection and the quality was good. We dined in twice for dinner and found the staff attentive and courteous and the food quality good. All in all a very pleasant stay and if there is one remark to be made it is that 'noises' from internal and external could be better controlled.

Reviews.Title: “Very elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alexis T
Reviews.Content: It is a very nice hotel with spacious rooms nad a nice view of Boshporous.It is near the Taxim square and the services are high quality.

Reviews.Title: “My very enjoyable vacatÄ±ons Ä±n Instanbul”
Reviews.Author: JOSE978
Reviews.Content: The hotel Ä±s very confortable and the servÄ±ce Ä±s very good, they provÄ±de you everythÄ±ng you want. TheÄ±r SPA Ä±s fantastÄ±c (the turkÄ±sh baÄ±n, massage, etc).

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem.”
Reviews.Author: 1roaming-gnomette
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best travel experiences I've ever had. The staff was wonderful. Everyone was very helpful, and spoke perfect English. Our room was on the 10th floor and had a beautiful view of the city and sea. A short walk, and we were in a main shopping district. We mastered the tram lines, and could be in the tourist district (Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, etc) in 20 minutes. The rooms were modern and well accomodated. Full windows everywhere, even in the shower! I took advantage of the spa as well, which was excellent and elegant. The gym needed better equipment, but I heard that second-hand, I didn't use it. We also used the concierge to book dinners and private cars, and again, the service was excellent. I asked the receptionist to teach me a few words of Turkish (yes, no, Thank You) and she was very excited to do so, and my new words made me a hit in all the little shops I visited. The restaurant was often empty, but also cozy. We spent one evening enjoying wine there, chatting with the bartender, and that was a lovely experience we won't forget. We will definitely be back! You won't regret this place for a single second.

Reviews.Title: “Great Gezi!”
Reviews.Author: Youssef S
Reviews.Content: Booked a double room at Gezi Hotel Bosphorus for 4 nights during the 1st week of October 2011. While we were going to attend a friend's wedding and didn't want to splurge, we still wanted a decent hotel. Gezi Hotel exceeded all of our expectations! The location was phenomenal as it was a 2-min walk to Istiqlal street, which is one of the busiest and entertaining streets in Istanbul and a similarly short walk to the metro. The staff were very responsive, courteous and helpful. The room was spotless, nicely decorated, spacious enough to comfortably accommodate 2 people, and the wi-fi was great. The breakfast was delicious with many choices. All in all, a great place to stay while in Istanbul! I just had one small remark. On the third day of our stay, it rained quite heavily and upon our return from a days-worth of site-seeing, we entered a floor and a room reeking of raw sewage! The rain had obviously caused some problems. The front desk apologized and moved us to another room within a couple of hours! I admit that this was the exception to an otherwise outstanding stay and understand that the circumstances were extenuating (heavy rain), but I would have expected a gesture characteristic of a boutique hotel to make up for the inconvenience. Anyways, this is probably something for management to keep in mind.

Reviews.Title: “By far one of the best”
Reviews.Author: TheTravellingGabo
Reviews.Content: Guys, I travel on a budget most of the times, I went to this hotel for work during my stay in istanbul. It 's December so the fees were very reasonable, I got a room on 3rd floor, with park view. Not the best in the hotel probably - but the room is just great, not very big, but elegant and classy, free wi-fi, nice flat screen, the bathroom with a huge rain shower. Service is excellent, so is breakfast served in a nice panoramic lounge. Location is good, right off Taksim Square, 3 minute walk and you are in the middle of the chaos :-) I recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: kokacha
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gezi Hotel in Istanbul for 6 nights and everything was an excellent experience. I found the hotel in internet and made all the reservation process by email. There were always clear and immediate answers. I wrote them many times asking many questions and I always had a kind and fast reply. The hotel is very well located, decoration and ambience are elegant and chic. Personal is very proffesional, friendly, kind and, specially, service oriented. They do more that what is expected from them and it was a common attitude (not an exceptional situation). We received an upgrade to a wonderful bosphorus view room. I also liked a dish they have the first day at the breakfast buffet and they voluntarily prepared it for me the rest of the days, even if it was not part of the breakfast menu, etc., etc., I would definitely recommend this hotel and will return to Gezi Hotel on my next trip to Istambul.

Reviews.Title: “elegant and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: dudu1000
Reviews.Content: Spend 2 nights there in May and was impressed with both the facilities and the service. The spa is great but the staff speaks little English. The Reception was helpful in translating. View from the corner rooms is worth the price. Spacious and well designed. Walking distance from the main shopping street. One restaurant only. Was empty most of the time but there were a lot of other places around to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely go back.”
Reviews.Author: LOVETHEBEACH71
Reviews.Content: During my one week stay, I have had a very pleasant stay at this hotel. The staff is very professional, courteous and accommodating. They even surprised me with a cake on my birthday. Special thanks to Mr. Gokhan, Ms. Nese, Ms. Hilal, Can, and all the other staff members. The rooms are clean and provide an excellent view of the Bosphorus. The price is very reasonable. The breakfast was sufficient. The location is very central and convenient. Whether you are in Istanbul for business or pleasure, and if you are looking for a boutique hotel, you should consider staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience! +++++”
Reviews.Author: Ana G
Reviews.Content: Right from the second we arrived at the hotel, the staff was extremely helpful and greeted us with a complementary orange juice and snack while we were checking in. The room was ready immediately and was very clean and quiet with an amazing view. Minibar had a really large selection of beverages and snacks, the bed was very comfortable and the shower was very relaxing. The occasion for my trip was my birthday, and upon my arrival back to the hotel from visiting Istanbul there was a cake, 2 glasses of white wine and a card from the hotel congratulating me, this was a very nice surprise especially since the room wasn't even registered in my name, so they are very attentive to the guests. The spa in the hotel is very nice too, there is a small sauna and steam room and while we where there for the weekend there weren't that many people at all, so it was practically like a private spa. I didn't do any treatments but there was a wide variety and the prices were reasonable. The breakfast was also very nice, is was situated on the ground floor with a view of the Bosphorus river, since the hotel is slightly on a hill and with a wide variety of food. There was everything from traditional turkish cheeses, pain au chocolat, a lot of dried fruit and delicious turkish coffee and freshly squeezed orange juice. The staff was very friendly and fluent in English. The location of this hotel is very central for that side of Istanbul, it's located right in Taksim Square, a 5 minute walk to the metro or a 10 minute ride to the old town. There is a huge shopping street located close by on which there are currency exchange points, restaurants and many stores. Also the majority of the modern restaurants are close by the hotel. Overall, my stay there was amazing and I would definitely recommend this hotel, especially since the prices were great for a 5 star hotel and it definitely deserved every star!

Reviews.Title: “Great Design Hotel with incredible view”
Reviews.Author: TouringTrick
Reviews.Content: I recently had the extreme pleasure of spending a night at the Gezi. My room had the most incredible view of the Bosphorus and when I woke up in the morning watching the ferries cross the Bosphorus river whilst I dreamily lay in bed. The hotels staff were very polite and friendly but do need to brush up on their local knowledge of what is on and where. However the waiters were fantastic and the breakfast in the morning was delicious. I really enjoyed the spa which although small was very private and extremely good. I loved the rooms and their layout and as the Havas Airport shuttle was just across the park ( some 25 metres) the whole experience was easy clean and perfect

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel..”
Reviews.Author: spemil
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days in this hotel recently.. The hotel is very nice . Nice design, very good service. Everybody is very kind and helpful. Spent 4 wonderful days there with another person...On the negative side i would just point out taht the rooms are not so big as hoped and that we had to keep the curtains down almost all the time in order not to have people looking into our room. For sure there will be other rooms that allow you more privacy, so i guess we were a ittle unlucky under that aspect... But all in all, i would recommend the hotel, especially if you can find a good deal....

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Choice for Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Alex C
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights in October 2011. The hotel is a great choice for anybody visiting Istanbul. The room was comfortable, spacious, clean, and modern. The staff was polite and helpful. The hotel serves a great complimentary breakfast. Finally, there is a very posh spa and a good gym in the hotel, my wife got a massage that she was very happy with. My only small complaint is the location. The hotel is within walking distance of all the action on Taksim square which is great. However, the hotel is located on the â€œuglyâ€� side of Taksim square where the pedestrian area gives way to a lot of cars and traffic. So stepping out of the hotel is not a thrilling experience, but you only have to walk for about 3 minutes to get to the hip areas of the city. The hotel is also a hike, but a doable hike, from the number one tram line which leads right to all the major tourist sites in the old city. All and all a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Abdulaziz”
Reviews.Author: abdulaziz o
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is more than great, less than 5 minutes walk to the metro and bus stations. Istiklal street nearby .the rooms are little bit small Breakfast includes wide variety of food. The hotel staffs were very friendly staff very helpful with directions and figuring out the metro and ferry times/locations to get me to may destinations .Very good hotel but they need to add coffee and tea machine in the room

Reviews.Title: “Well furnished hotel in a prime location”
Reviews.Author: Firas A
Reviews.Content: Ideal location, great view , excellent interior, very nice and clean spa with excellent facilities and services, well equipped bathroom , very friendly staff especially Mr. Halil Ozkilic who showes outstanding hospitality . I would recommend this hotel as one of the best hotel in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Bosphorus view with your head on the pillow”
Reviews.Author: Rharib
Reviews.Content: When I first walked into the lobby, it wasn't as big as I expected, but the warm welcome I got from the reception employees was great, it took me 5 minutes to get to my room, I still remember the receptionists name "Can" as he offered me something to drink then took my passport copy and up I went, the luggage was placed on the luggage mount in my room.. It's a three minute walk from istiklal shopping area"Taksim", 3 mins walk to the nearest metro, neighbored by hotels such as intercontinental and Hyatt so you can tell it's one of the best, I've been to intercontinental and marmarah hotels and Gezi hotel bosphorus is the place to be if you like a quiet atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in Taksim”
Reviews.Author: danpr
Reviews.Content: I came here based on these reviews -- and a good discount on hotels.com -- and I was still blown away by the service and luxury. It is a small boutique hotel, so feels far more relaxed than the gargantuan 5* places. The quality of the furnishings and overall design is far nicer than the Ramada and Hilton (where my colleagues stayed), which are beginning to show their age (the Hilton of course, wins on sheer size and opulence, but is far more expensive). I was very impressed by the complimentary chocolates and water, free wifi and free access to the spa and fitness centre. Minor quibbles: the fitness centre could use some heavier weights and there is no pool. The rooftop bar is not yet open, but will no doubt be the icing on the cake. Highly recommended hotel, and one of the best I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great all round for comfort and location”
Reviews.Author: MattJMurray
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gezi Hotel August 12- 2011 in a Deluxe Park View room. Taxi from Ataturk Airport was about 20-25 mins although our driver seemed to have trouble finding it. Not sure why as the major selling point of Gezi has to be its location, which is only a 3 or 4 minute stroll from the main commercial street of istanbul. The room was relatively small but comfortable and well equipped with very helpful staff and concierge service. The dining room/bar is well worth a visit with some spectacular views although drinks and food were pretty expensive. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our trip to Istanbul, a cosmopolitan and friendly modern city, very different from what I was expecting and wouldn't hesistate to recommend the Gezi hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great View, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AJJourneyMan
Reviews.Content: First visit to Istanbul and using TA I booked the Gezi Hotel. If you want all the facilities, service and quality of a large scale chain in a 70 room design hotel then this is the place. New feeling hotel, quality bathrooms and good service. You should try and book a Bosphorus view at floor 5 and above as the view really is remarkable. Gym and new spa available. 3 mins walk from the hussle and bussle of Taksim. A member of staff was kind enough to advise I use the overground metro and not take a taxi to visit the Sultanahmet sights such as the blue mosque. Great idea, as it was air conditioned, clean, fast and only 1.75 Lira one way. Shame I only had 3 days in Istanbul as so much more to see , do and eat. As you can tell I would come back to Istanbul and the Gezi.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Badboyusa
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel to much,room is very comfortable,staff is very kind specialy ms.nese very helpfull,friendly and kindly we would like to thank you to her for help.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shatta84
Reviews.Content: This was a superb boutique hotel just off the main part of Taksim Square in Istanbul, and catered to everything I wanted. From the amazing service, to the fantastic bar and restaurant, to the chic rooms and comfy bed. I thought that the Gezi Hotel really fit my needs as a single male traveler from the U.S. There was also a really nice spa, but I never found the need to use it. Great location, trendy spot, and quite an affordable price.... I would stay here again when in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy!!”
Reviews.Author: Ramroom
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable rooms, cute little hotel with excellent location. Simple and nice. Friendly staff. Free Wifi. Manager, Ms. Seygul Yildiz, was very cooperative and responsive to emails ahead of arrival, thanks! Breakfast is of any 4-star hotel but restaurant staff can be more attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Response to Survey”
Reviews.Author: creedsTexas
Reviews.Content: Service and personnel were excellent. Our suite was comfortable, quiet and in good shape. There were a couple of potential safety issues that I think the hotel should address. The staircase in my room had no handrail. That and the wooden steps could lead to a slip/fall. The steps underneath the staircase were finished with sharp corners and the luggage rack was directly below which could result in a bump/cut on the head if one hit the stair corner when packing/unpacking.AYSENDAZ YENI is an outstaanding hotel representative!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with good facilty”
Reviews.Author: Johani_AM
Reviews.Content: the hotel is great for busniess & shopping it's in the center of Taksim. Center of Istanbul. it has very good facilties and very nice view on Bosphorus.

Reviews.Title: “Wish if i could stay there forever :)”
Reviews.Author: Rayanati
Reviews.Content: Amazing view, spectacular location, very friendly staff that welcome you as if you're home. Various breakfast and a luxiours rooms, Simply loved it , no Complaints what so over :) Stayed there for 9 nights but i wish if i couldv'e stayed there forever !

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: CJAlmeby
Reviews.Content: A really fab hotel with exellent location just off Taksim Square.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay with The Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Otaibi
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, I stayed at room 1001, the room was overlooking Gezi Park, which had a small cafe on the corner. I highly recommend this hotel for Istanbul first timers, for its strategic location, only 2 minutes walk to Istiklal and taksim. Breakfast buffet was nice as well. I also LOVED their shower. Only thing i didn't like about the hotel is that they don't provide an ironer, you have to use their laundry service, which was a little bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and nice but as a 4star, not a 5star”
Reviews.Author: Toomaj
Reviews.Content: I am not considering it as a 5* hotel, but as a 4* one it is fabulous. Rooms are very small 25msq but very cozy and clean. Bosphorus view is great but a little bit noisy because there is a Bus Station right under the Bosphorus side of te building. We stayed in a corner room with a nice view. Actually there are some very small deficits there, e.g. very small bathroom, not a van inside the bathroom. some accessories do not exist like toothpaste, toothbrush, "do not disturb" sign. Breakfast buffet is very good with fresh and delicious stuff, but is closed and sometimes it is nice to eat breakfast or have a rest in an open area restaurant or cafe at the hotel. The roof restaurant was closed. Totally the hotel is very small and far from the imagination you have of Gran Hyatt, Swissotel, Hilton, etc. but according to the price it seems reasonable. The very best point is the location and closeness to the Taxim Square and Dolmabahce Sarayi. Also the metro station is very close. The free wireless internet is the other good point. Minibar and in-room services are very expensive, not recommended. Also, no balcony if you want to smoke. No pool but there is a nice and new spa and fitness center, although the massage price is very expensive. In total, staying in this hotel is very pleasant unless you do not compare it to other high ranked hotels like mentioned above.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: dpapado
Reviews.Content: I only stayed for 1 night on a 2-day business trip, on the 7th floor, in a double room with a magnificent view on Bosphorus! It was all I could ask for and more. Even the low rate rooms were looking on a great garden. I will definetely be back.

Reviews.Title: “dark and cold”
Reviews.Author: cervino75
Reviews.Content: Room was small and lighting system was not enough, during dark ours was very difficult to work also because the room are not big enough to have a proper desk were to work. But the worst was concerning the heating system which is connected to the room card holder so every time I went out the room the heating system switched off and when I came back the room was just frozen Positive aspects are the cleanness of the room and the nice and big breakfast room

Reviews.Title: “This brand new hotel has all you need for a perfect stay !”
Reviews.Author: vpapazis
Reviews.Content: This brand new hotel is situated near all the great hotels in the neighbourhood of Taxim Square. My room with view at the Bosphorus was amazing ! But also my friend's room with view at the park was incredible. The marble bathroom was astonishing !!! The service was excellent. Very good breakfast buffet, with plenty of choices. I felt like a princess.

Reviews.Title: “A reason to visit Istanbul again”
Reviews.Author: alesofin
Reviews.Content: My partner and me visited Istanbul for a four days city break and we chose to stay to this hotel because of its central position and we did not regret it. Our room was a Superior Corner one which was a good choice as the Bosphorus and Istanbul view was amazing from its windows even from the bathroom. The personnel was great and they were very helpful to provide us with information and to find us a taxi whenever we asked for it. The breakfast was very good with a great variety of food. A complimentary tray with sweets was served every afternoon in our room. There is also free wi-fi. Our only minor complain is that during our stay they did not change our sheets. All in all it was a great stay and we will definitely stay again to the Gezi hotel when we will return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “good and bad in one review”
Reviews.Author: Mleine
Reviews.Content: It's hard to write anything negative about this hotel, because the personal and the manager were so incredibly kind to make the best out of our stay. They really did their utmost to help us out with any information about Istanbul, taxis or even a change of room. But I have to be honest about the facilities. Only the rooms on the floors 4+ have a great view, the other floors have a view of the parking lot. And please ask for a room away from the restaurant, since this can be noisy during the night, after dinner or before breakfast. Standard rooms are not too big, suites are perfect. Design is beautiful, very classy. Great beds. Location is good, near the big shopping street and close to the old town.

HotelInfo.Name: Gezi Hotel Bosphorus
HotelInfo.Address: Mete Cd. No:34 | Taksim Square, Istanbul 34437, Turkey
